intro: Phalangium elatum, commonly known as the giant centipede plant, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its large, showy inflorescence composed of a spadix and a spathe. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in a dense cluster on the spadix. It thrives in warm, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Phalangium elatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
